definition: to settle/to finish/to conclude/to wind up
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
unofficial variant of 瞭[liao4]
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
(of eyes) bright/clear-sighted/to understand clearly
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]

sentences.english: He has had a bit of trouble, and I have to straighten it out for him.
sentences.chinese: 他遇到了点儿麻烦，我得替他把这事了结掉。

sentences.english: You see, Giles, my case is not settled yet .
sentences.chinese: 你知道，基尔斯，我的那个案子还没有了结。

sentences.english: He must be in at the finish.
sentences.chinese: 事情了结的时候，他一定跑不了。

sentences.english: Others would note that maybe it had something to do with closure.
sentences.chinese: 其他人会留意到，这也许与了结一切的心态有关。

sentences.english: They tied the matter up at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他们在会议上了结了这件事。

sentences.english: This move by the exchange may have been designed to facilitate large-scale liquidations of the metals.
sentences.chinese: 该交易所此举或旨在促使金属大规模的了结。

sentences.english: I'm glad my legal difficulties are allover.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴我的法律问题了结了。

sentences.english: Giles, my case is not settled yet .
sentences.chinese: 你知道，基尔斯，我的那个案子还没有了结。

sentences.english: Finish old business as quickly and completely as you can. The pace is about to pick up again, with new possibilities.
sentences.chinese: 尽快完善地了结旧务，事情伴随新的机会接踵而至。

sentences.english: My friends, this must come to an end.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友们，这必须来个了结。

sentences.english: The whole matter is now sealed up and finished.
sentences.chinese: 整个事情现已封锁起来，就此了结了。

sentences.english: Profit-taking towards the end of the session pushed the market lower.
sentences.chinese: 尾盘时投资人获利了结，股市下滑。

sentences.english: Down in some lonesome valley, hangin' from a white oak tree.
sentences.chinese: 也许在偏僻的山谷里，在一棵白橡树上自我了结。

sentences.english: Young Werther eventually ends his live as the end of the story.
sentences.chinese: 少年维特最终以了结生命结束了故事。

sentences.english: And just when I was thinking about putting an end to my life, you show up and drink my poison.
sentences.chinese: 刚想了结生命，你又走了过来，还喝了我杯毒酒。

sentences.english: I have been very busy settling up things about the training course.
sentences.chinese: 我最近一直忙于了结训练班的事。

definition: to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
to write off at one stroke
to resolve/to settle
to stop/to pull back
lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
to stop at this point/to end here/to call it a day
as the water recedes, the rocks appear (idiom)/the truth comes to light
once the main problem is solved, all troubles are solved/death ends all one's troubles
to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
to give up
hatred and desire for revenge
to settle (a dispute out of court)/to reconcile/settlement/conciliation/to become reconciled
already
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to be even/to be quits/to be even-steven
